item.title: 研究发现巴西儿童癌症死亡与大豆种植有关
item.description:
Soy farming has been linked to a rise in child cancer deaths in Brazil, the world's biggest producer and exporter of the oilseed and one of the top users of pesticides for protecting crops from disease and pests, according to a study in the South American country.翻译:南美国家的一项研究显示，大豆种植与巴西儿童癌症死亡人数上升有关。巴西是世界上最大的油籽生产国和出口国，也是保护农作物免受病虫害的农药的最大使用国之一。

The peer-reviewed study published on Monday in PNAS, the journal of the U.S. National Academy of Sciences, found that as soy cultivation expanded in Brazil, "agricultural pesticide exposure was associated with increased childhood cancer mortality among the broader population indirectly exposed to these chemicals."翻译:周一发表在美国国家科学院院刊《PNAS》上的同行评审研究发现，随着巴西大豆种植面积的扩大，“在间接接触这些化学物质的更广泛人群中，接触农业农药与儿童癌症死亡率增加有关”。

The U.S. researchers found a relationship between soy production and related community exposure to agrochemicals including glyphosate, a widely used weedkiller that some genetically modified soybean seeds are designed to tolerate.翻译:美国研究人员发现，大豆生产与相关社区接触农用化学品（包括草甘膦）之间存在关系，草甘膦是一种广泛使用的除草剂，一些转基因大豆种子可以耐受这种除草剂。

"We find a statistically significant increase in pediatric leukemia following expanded local soy production," the PNAS article said, based on Brazilian childhood cancer incidence and disease mortality data spanning 15 years.翻译:《美国国家科学院院刊》的文章根据巴西 15 年儿童癌症发病率和疾病死亡率数据得出，“我们发现，随着当地大豆生产的扩大，儿童白血病的发病率在统计上显着增加。”

Greater pesticide use is likely contaminating water supplies near soy farms, the researchers speculated.翻译:研究人员推测，更多的农药使用可能会污染大豆农场附近的水源。

Specifically, the study found a correlation between soy farming and childhood blood cancers, especially acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL), the most common blood cancer in children.翻译:具体来说，该研究发现大豆种植与儿童血癌之间存在相关性，尤其是儿童最常见的血癌急性淋巴细胞白血病（ALL）。

There were 123 additional deaths of children under age 10 from 2008 to 2019 from ALL following the expansion of soybean production in Brazil, the researchers found.翻译:研究人员发现，随着巴西大豆产量的扩大，2008 年至 2019 年间，又有 123 名 10 岁以下儿童死于急性淋巴细胞白血病。

That number would have been higher were it not for the country's high-quality cancer treatment centers, the researchers said.翻译:研究人员表示，如果没有该国高质量的癌症治疗中心，这个数字还会更高。

With the use of GMO soy on increasingly larger areas, Brazil's production nearly doubled over the last decade, to a record 154.6 million metric tons this year, according to Brazilian government data.翻译:根据巴西政府数据，随着转基因大豆的使用面积越来越大，巴西的产量在过去十年中几乎翻了一番，今年达到创纪录的 1.546 亿吨。

The country sells most of its soybean exports to China and for years has been competing with the United States, where chemicals such as glyphosate are also widely used, in global soy markets.翻译:该国将大部分大豆出口销往中国，多年来一直在全球大豆市场与美国竞争，美国也广泛使用草甘膦等化学品。

Reporting by Ana Mano; Editing by Nancy Lapid and Bill Berkrot翻译:安娜·马诺报道；南希·拉皮德和比尔·伯克罗特编辑

item.title: 中国在AI峰会上呼吁全球合作，马斯克需要一位“裁判”
item.description:
Summary:
  • AI Safety Summit to be held at Bletchley Park翻译:人工智能安全峰会将在布莱切利公园举行
  • Tech execs and political leaders to discuss risks翻译:科技高管和政治领导人讨论风险

China said on Wednesday it wanted to work with international partners to manage the oversight of artificial intelligence as political leaders and technology executives gathered at an inaugural AI Safety Summit in Britain to plot the way forward.翻译:中国周三表示，希望与国际合作伙伴合作，管理人工智能的监管，政治领导人和技术高管齐聚英国举行的首届人工智能安全峰会，规划未来发展方向。

Some tech bosses and political leaders have warned the rapid development of AI poses an existential threat to the world, sparking a race by governments and international institutions to design safeguards and regulation for the future.翻译:一些科技巨头和政治领导人警告说，人工智能的快速发展对世界构成了生存威胁，引发了各国政府和国际机构竞相为未来设计保障措施和监管。

In a first for Western efforts to manage the safe development of AI, a Chinese vice minister joined leaders from the United States and the European Union, alongside tech bosses such as Elon Musk and ChatGPT's Sam Altman.翻译:中国副部长与美国和欧盟领导人以及埃隆·马斯克 (Elon Musk) 和 ChatGPT 的萨姆·奥尔特曼 (Sam Altman) 等科技巨头一起，在西方国家首次努力管理人工智能的安全发展。

"China is willing to enhance our dialogue and communication in AI safety with all sides, contributing to an international mechanism with global participation in governance framework that needs wide consensus," Wu Zhaohui said at the start of the summit, according to an official translation of his remarks.翻译:吴朝晖在峰会开始时表示：“中方愿与各方加强在人工智能安全领域的对话与沟通，为建立全球参与、需要广泛共识的治理框架做出贡献。”他的言论。

"Countries regardless of their size and scale have equal rights to develop and use AI," he added.翻译:“国家无论大小，都拥有平等的开发和使用人工智能的权利，”他补充道。

Musk, who has warned about the risks of AI, said the summit wanted to establish a "third-party referee" for companies developing the technology, so it could sound the alarm when risks develop, and so instil confidence in the public.翻译:曾对人工智能风险发出警告的马斯克表示，峰会希望为开发该技术的公司建立一个“第三方裁判”，以便在风险出现时发出警报，从而给公众灌输信心。

The meeting - held at Bletchley Park, home of Britain's World War Two code-breakers - is the brainchild of Prime Minister Rishi Sunak. He wants to carve out a role for Britain as an intermediary between the economic blocs of the United States, China and the EU.翻译:这次会议在布莱奇利公园举行，这里是英国第二次世界大战密码破译者的故乡，是首相里希·苏纳克 (Rishi Sunak) 的创意。他希望让英国成为美国、中国和欧盟经济集团之间的中间人。

The summit is focused on highly capable general-purpose models called "frontier AI"翻译:此次峰会的重点是被称为“前沿人工智能”的高性能通用模型

Participating governments produced a "Bletchley Declaration", with 28 countries and the EU agreeing the need for transparency and accountability from actors in frontier AI technology, including how they will measure, monitor and mitigate potentially harmful capabilities.翻译:参与国政府制定了一份“布莱切利宣言”，28 个国家和欧盟同意前沿人工智能技术参与者需要透明度和问责制，包括他们将如何衡量、监控和减轻潜在的有害能力。

A COLLECTIVE PLAN翻译:集体计划

British digital minister Michelle Donelan said it was an achievement just to get so many key players in one room.翻译:英国数字部长米歇尔·多尼兰 (Michelle Donelan) 表示，能在一个房间里聚集这么多关键人物就已经是一项成就了。

"For the first time, we now have countries agreeing that we need to look not just independently but collectively at the risk around frontier AI," she told reporters.翻译:她对记者说：“现在各国第一次同意，我们不仅需要独立地审视前沿人工智能的风险，还需要集体地审视。”

China is a key participant, given the country's role in developing AI technology. However, some British lawmakers have questioned whether it should be there given the low level of trust between Beijing, Washington and many European capitals when it comes to Chinese involvement in technology.翻译:鉴于中国在开发人工智能技术方面的作用，中国是一个关键参与者。然而，鉴于北京、华盛顿和许多欧洲国家首都之间在中国参与科技方面的信任度较低，一些英国立法者质疑是否应该这样做。

The United States made clear on the eve of the summit that the call to Beijing had very much come from Britain, with its Ambassador to London, Jane Hartley, telling Reuters: "This is the UK invitation, this is not the U.S.".翻译:美国在峰会前夕明确表示，对北京的邀请很大程度上来自英国，其驻伦敦大使简·哈特利(Jane Hartley)告诉路透社：“这是英国的邀请，不是美国”。

U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris also spoke in London on Wednesday, away from the summit, setting out her government's response to AI, after U.S. President Joe Biden signed an executive order on Monday.翻译:在美国总统乔·拜登周一签署行政命令后，美国副总统卡马拉·哈里斯周三也在伦敦峰会之外发表讲话，阐述了政府对人工智能的回应。

The timing and location of her speech has raised eyebrows among some in the UK's governing Conservative Party who suggest Washington is trying to overshadow Sunak's summit - a charge denied by British officials who say they want as many voices as possible. Harris will meet Sunak later on Wednesday and attend the summit's second day on Thursday.翻译:她演讲的时间和地点引起了英国执政保守党中一些人的不满，他们认为华盛顿试图给苏纳克峰会蒙上阴影，但英国官员否认了这一指控，称他们希望有尽可能多的声音。哈里斯将于周三晚些时候会见苏纳克，并于周四参加峰会第二天。

U.S. Secretary of Commerce Gina Raimondo used the summit to announce the launch of a U.S. AI Safety Institute, and said it would cooperate with Britain's recently announced institute.翻译:美国商务部长吉娜·雷蒙多利用此次峰会宣布成立美国人工智能安全研究所，并表示将与英国最近宣布的研究所合作。

Canada's minister of innovation, science and industry Francois-Philippe Champagne said AI would not be constrained by national borders, and therefore interoperability between different regulations being put in place was important.翻译:加拿大创新、科学和工业部长弗朗索瓦·菲利普·商鹏飞表示，人工智能不会受到国界的限制，因此不同法规之间的互操作性非常重要。

"The risk is that we do too little, rather than too much, given the evolution and speed with which things are going," he told Reuters.翻译:他告诉路透社：“考虑到事情的发展和速度，风险在于我们做得太少，而不是太多。”

On the agenda are topics like how AI systems might be used by terrorists to build bioweapons and the technology's potential to outsmart humans and wreak havoc on the world.翻译:议程上的主题包括人工智能系统如何被恐怖分子用来制造生物武器，以及该技术有可能智胜人类并对世界造成严重破坏。

Reporting by Paul Sandle and Martin Coulter Editing by Mark Potter翻译:保罗·桑德尔和马丁·库尔特报道 马克·波特编辑

item.title: 美国副总统哈里斯呼吁对“全方位”人工智能风险采取行动
item.description:
U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris on Wednesday called for urgent action to protect the public and democracy from the dangers posed by artificial intelligence, announcing a series of initiatives to address safety concerns about the technology.翻译:美国副总统卡马拉·哈里斯周三呼吁采取紧急行动，保护公众和民主免受人工智能带来的危险，并宣布了一系列举措来解决对该技术的安全担忧。

In a speech at the U.S. Embassy in London, Harris spoke of the dangers AI could pose for individuals and the Western political system.翻译:哈里斯在美国驻伦敦大使馆的一次演讲中谈到了人工智能可能给个人和西方政治体系带来的危险。

The technology has the potential to create "cyberattacks at a scale beyond anything we have seen before" or "AI-formulated bioweapons that could endanger the lives of millions", she said.翻译:她说，这项技术有可能造成“规模超出我们以前见过的网络攻击”或“人工智能配制的生物武器，可能危及数百万人的生命”。

"These threats are often referred to as the 'existential threats of AI', because they could endanger the very existence of humanity," Harris added.翻译:哈里斯补充道：“这些威胁通常被称为‘人工智能的生存威胁’，因为它们可能危及人类的生存。”

The United States on Wednesday announced plans to establish a new AI Safety Institute, which will assess potential risks. Britain announced a similar initiative last week.翻译:美国周三宣布计划建立一个新的人工智能安全研究所，该研究所将评估潜在风险。英国上周宣布了类似的举措。

The timing of her speech was questioned by some British executives and lawmakers, who suggested Washington was trying to overshadow Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's AI Safety Summit, which takes place on Wednesday and Thursday.翻译:她的演讲时机受到一些英国高管和立法者的质疑，他们认为华盛顿试图掩盖首相里希·苏纳克周三和周四举行的人工智能安全峰会。

Harris has invited a number of research groups to join her for a closed-door event at the embassy in London on Wednesday, according to two sources, meaning some attendees may have to leave the summit at Bletchley Park early.翻译:据两位消息人士透露，哈里斯已邀请多个研究小组与她一起参加周三在伦敦大使馆举行的闭门活动，这意味着一些与会者可能不得不提前离开布莱切利公园的峰会。

"It's a huge issue, and it undermines the core focus here," said Sachin Dev Duggal, founder of London-based AI firm Builder.ai.翻译:总部位于伦敦的人工智能公司 Builder.ai 的创始人 Sachin Dev Duggal 表示：“这是一个大问题，它破坏了这里的核心焦点。”

Harris's speech made only brief reference to the British event, which she will attend on Thursday.翻译:哈里斯的讲话仅简要提及她将于周四参加的英国活动。

British officials denied any concerns, however, saying they wanted more voices to be speaking in the debate.翻译:不过，英国官员否认了任何担忧，称他们希望在辩论中发出更多声音。

"It's not necessarily a bad thing that the U.S. has announced a policy blitz to coincide with the summit," a source from Britain's technology department told Reuters. "We would obviously prefer it if guests didn't leave early."翻译:英国技术部门的一位消息人士对路透社表示：“美国在峰会期间宣布了政策闪电战，这并不一定是坏事。” “如果客人不提前离开，我们显然会更愿意。”

THREATS TO DEMOCRACY

In her speech, Harris called for a broader definition of AI safety to include the "full spectrum" of threats, including bias, discrimination and the spread of disinformation.翻译:哈里斯在演讲中呼吁对人工智能安全进行更广泛的定义，以涵盖“全方位”的威胁，包括偏见、歧视和虚假信息的传播。

Examples she gave included elderly people being denied healthcare because of a faulty AI algorithm or women being threatened by abusive partners with explicit fake photographs.翻译:她举的例子包括老年人因人工智能算法错误而被拒绝获得医疗服务，或者女性受到虐待伴侣用露骨的假照片的威胁。

"When people around the world cannot discern fact from fiction because of a flood of AI-enabled myths and disinformation, I ask, is that not existential for democracy?" she said.翻译:“当世界各地的人们因为人工智能的神话和虚假信息泛滥而无法辨别事实和虚构时，我问，这对民主来说不是存在的吗？”她说。

Harris's speech comes after U.S. President Joe Biden signed an executive order on Monday to give the U.S. government greater oversight of AI systems that could pose risks to national security, the economy, public health or safety.翻译:哈里斯发表讲话之前，美国总统乔·拜登周一签署了一项行政命令，要求美国政府对可能对国家安全、经济、公共卫生或安全构成风险的人工智能系统进行更大的监督。

The new U.S. AI Safety Institute will share information and collaborate on research with peer institutions internationally, including Britain's planned AI Safety Institute.翻译:新的美国人工智能安全研究所将与国际同行机构共享信息并合作研究，其中包括计划中的英国人工智能安全研究所。

Harris also said 30 countries have agreed to sign a U.S.-sponsored political declaration for the use of AI by national militaries.翻译:哈里斯还表示，30 个国家已同意签署美国发起的国家军队使用人工智能的政治宣言。

Reporting by Andrew MacAskill and Martin Coulter, Editing by Elizabeth Piper, Kate Holton and Catherine Evans翻译:安德鲁·麦克阿斯基尔和马丁·库尔特报道，伊丽莎白·派珀、凯特·霍尔顿和凯瑟琳·埃文斯编辑

item.title: 巨大的原始碰撞的遗迹位于地球深处
item.description:
Seismologists have recognized since the 1970s that two mysterious continent-sized blobs reside in the deepest part of Earth's mantle, one under Africa and the other under the South Pacific region.翻译:自 20 世纪 70 年代以来，地震学家已经认识到，地幔最深处存在着两个神秘的大陆大小的斑点，一个位于非洲下方，另一个位于南太平洋地区下方。

These blobs, denser than the material surrounding them, may be relics from a cataclysm early in our planet's history hypothesized to have spawned the moon - the collision between primordial Earth and a Mars-sized object called Theia, researchers said on Wednesday.翻译:研究人员周三表示，这些斑点比周围的物质密度更大，可能是地球历史早期一场灾难的遗迹，这场灾难被认为是产生月球的——原始地球和火星大小的忒伊亚天体之间的碰撞。

This giant impact, which recent research determined occurred 4.46 billion years ago, blasted molten rock into space that orbited Earth and coalesced into the moon. But chunks of Theia may have remained inside Earth, sinking to a location just above our planet's wickedly hot spherical core of iron and nickel.翻译:最近的研究确定，这次巨大的撞击发生在 44.6 亿年前，它将熔岩喷射到绕地球运行的太空中，并融入月球。但忒伊亚的大块可能仍留在地球内部，沉入地球由铁和镍组成的炽热球形核心上方的某个位置。

The researchers ran computer simulations examining the impact event, geophysical properties of the material that likely made up Theia and the evolution of Earth's mantle - the broadest of the layers that comprise our planet's interior structure at about 1,800 miles (2,900 km) thick.翻译:研究人员进行了计算机模拟，检查了撞击事件、可能构成忒伊亚的物质的地球物理特性以及地幔的演化。地幔是构成地球内部结构的最广泛的层，厚约 1,800 英里（2,900 公里）。

Based on these simulations, they proposed that most of Theia was absorbed into Earth, forming the blobs, while residual debris formed the moon.翻译:根据这些模拟，他们提出大部分忒伊亚被地球吸收，形成了斑点，而残余碎片则形成了月球。

"The bottoms of these blobs are 2,900 kilometers below our feet. The two blobs are about 2% of Earth's mass. They were detected by seismology as seismic waves travel slower within these two regions compared to the surrounding mantle. Each of the blobs are twice the mass of the whole moon. So, the blobs are massive," said Caltech geophysicist Qian Yuan, lead author of the study published in the journal Nature.翻译:“这些斑点的底部距离我们脚下 2,900 公里。这两个斑点约占地球质量的 2%。地震学检测到它们是因为地震波在这两个区域内的传播速度比周围的地幔慢。每个斑点都是地球质量的两倍。发表在《自然》杂志上的这项研究的主要作者、加州理工学院地球物理学家钱源说：

If the study's conclusions are correct, these blobs would represent the first direct evidence of the hypothesized moon-forming collision.翻译:如果研究的结论是正确的，这些斑点将成为假设的月球形成碰撞的第一个直接证据。

"There hasn't been much consensus on whether we can find evidence for this event not just in the moon but also in some observable property of the modern Earth," Caltech geology and geochemistry professor and study co-author Paul Asimow said.翻译:加州理工学院地质学和地球化学教授兼研究合著者保罗·阿西莫（Paul Asimow）表示：“对于我们是否不仅能在月球上找到这一事件的证据，而且还能在现代地球的一些可观测特性中找到这一事件的证据，还没有达成太多共识。”

The two blobs, Asimow added, "are the biggest deviations in Earth structure from a simple layered planet."翻译:阿西莫补充说，这两个斑点“是地球结构与简单层状行星的最大偏差”。

"It is incredible because we can uncover relics of another planet - Theia - if we dig deep enough in Earth's mantle," added planetary scientist and study co-author Hongping Deng of the Chinese Academy of Sciences' Shanghai Astronomical Observatory.翻译:中国科学院上海天文台的行星科学家、研究合著者邓红平补充道：“这真是令人难以置信，因为如果我们在地幔中挖掘得足够深，我们就能发现另一颗行星——忒伊亚的遗迹。”

The increased density of the blobs is thought to arise from their high level of iron - much like moon rocks, which would make sense if they are made of the same source material from Theia.翻译:这些斑点的密度增加被认为是由于它们的铁含量很高——很像月球岩石，如果它们是由来自忒伊亚的相同来源材料制成的，那就有意义了。

"After the impact, these impactor materials would sink down to the core-mantle boundary because they likely have higher density than ambient mantle, and it is the extra density that allows them to survive Earth's whole history," Yuan said.翻译:袁说：“撞击后，这些撞击物材料会下沉到地核-地幔边界，因为它们的密度可能比周围地幔更高，而正是额外的密度使它们能够在地球的整个历史中幸存下来。”

The moon, which orbits Earth at an average distance of about 239,000 miles (385,000 km), has a diameter of about 2,160 miles (3,475 km), a bit more than a quarter of our planet's diameter.翻译:月球绕地球运行的平均距离约为 239,000 英里（385,000 公里），直径约为 2,160 英里（3,475 公里），略大于地球直径的四分之一。

Asimow said that if their conclusions are correct some volcanic rocks that reach Earth's surface may provide samples of a vanished planet.翻译:阿西莫说，如果他们的结论是正确的，一些到达地球表面的火山岩可能会提供消失行星的样本。

"If our model is correct, the blobs should have isotopes - trace elements - that are similar to the lunar mantle rocks, which can be tested in future lunar missions," Yuan said.翻译:袁说：“如果我们的模型正确，这些斑点应该含有与月幔岩石类似的同位素（微量元素），可以在未来的月球任务中进行测试。”

Gaining a greater understanding of the hypothesized giant impact may provide insight concerning the evolution of Earth and other rocky planets in our solar system and beyond.翻译:更好地了解假设的巨大撞击可能会提供有关地球和太阳系及其他地区其他岩石行星演化的见解。

"We suspect that large impacts are common in the later stages of accretion of all terrestrial (rocky) planets and exoplanets," Asimow said. "As we try to develop a catalog of what the possible outcomes of planet formation are - how likely is a planet like Earth, rather than like Mars, Mercury, Venus or none of the above, and hence how likely are we to find other Earth-like planets - it follows that we need to work out the consequences of these impacts."翻译:阿西莫说：“我们怀疑，在所有类地（岩石）行星和系外行星吸积的后期阶段，大规模撞击是常见的。” “当我们试图编制一个行星形成可能结果的目录时，行星像地球一样的可能性有多大，而不是像火星、水星、金星或以上都不是，因此我们找到其他地球的可能性有多大-就像行星一样 - 因此我们需要计算出这些影响的后果。”

Reporting by Will Dunham, Editing by Rosalba O'Brien翻译:威尔·邓纳姆报道，罗萨尔巴·奥布莱恩编辑

item.title: 美国众议院小组寻求禁止联邦政府购买中国无人机
item.description:
The top members of a U.S. House committee on China are introducing a bill that seeks to ban the U.S. government from buying Chinese drones.翻译:美国众议院中国问题委员会的高级成员正在提出一项法案，旨在禁止美国政府购买中国无人机。

Mike Gallagher, the Republican chair of the committee, and Raja Krishnamoorthi, the ranking Democrat, are introducing the "American Security Drone Act" on Wednesday, the lawmakers said in a statement to Reuters.翻译:立法者在给路透社的一份声明中表示，该委员会的共和党主席迈克·加拉格尔（Mike Gallagher）和民主党资深人士拉贾·克里希纳莫蒂（Raja Krishnamoorthi）将于周三推出“美国安全无人机法案”。

"This bill would prohibit the federal government from using American taxpayer dollars to purchase this equipment from countries like China," Gallagher said. "It is imperative that Congress pass this bipartisan bill to protect U.S. interests and our national security supply chain."翻译:加拉格尔说：“该法案将禁止联邦政府使用美国纳税人的钱从中国等国家购买这种设备。” “国会必须通过这项两党法案，以保护美国的利益和我们的国家安全供应链。”

The bill would also bar local and state governments from purchasing Chinese drones using federal grants and require a federal report detailing the amount of foreign commercial off-the-shelf drones and covered unmanned aircraft systems procured by federal departments and agencies from China.翻译:该法案还将禁止地方和州政府使用联邦拨款购买中国无人机，并要求联邦报告详细说明联邦部门和机构从中国采购的外国商业现成无人机和涵盖的无人机系统的数量。

Krishnamoorthi said the bill "helps protect against any vulnerabilities posed by our government agencies’ reliance on foreign-manufactured drone technology and will encourage growth in the U.S. drone industry."翻译:克里希纳莫蒂表示，该法案“有助于防止我们的政府机构依赖外国制造的无人机技术而造成的任何漏洞，并将鼓励美国无人机行业的增长。”

Separately, the U.S. Senate on Tuesday unanimously approved an amendment proposed by Republican Senator Marsha Blackburn and Democrat Mark Warner that would prohibit the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) from operating or providing federal funds for drones produced in China, Russia, Iran, North Korea, Venezuela or Cuba.翻译:另外，美国参议院周二一致批准了共和党参议员玛莎·布莱克本和民主党人马克·沃纳提出的一项修正案，该修正案将禁止联邦航空管理局（FAA）为中国、俄罗斯、伊朗、朝鲜生产的无人机运营或提供联邦资金。委内瑞拉或古巴。

“Taxpayer dollars should never fund drones manufactured in regions that are hostile toward our nation,” Blackburn said.翻译:布莱克本说：“纳税人的钱永远不应该资助在对我们国家怀有敌意的地区制造的无人机。”

China recently announced export controls on some drones and drone-related equipment, saying it wanted to safeguard "national security and interests."翻译:中国最近宣布对一些无人机和无人机相关设备实施出口管制，称其希望维护“国家安全和利益”。

The Commerce Department in 2020 imposed export restrictions on China-based drone manufacturer DJI, accusing it of complicity in the oppression of China's Uyghur minority and helping the military.翻译:美国商务部于 2020 年对中国无人机制造商大疆创新实施了出口限制，指责其共谋压迫中国维吾尔少数民族并帮助军方。

Over 50% of drones sold in the United States are made by DJI, and they are the most popular drones in use by public safety agencies, Republican lawmakers said earlier this year.翻译:共和党议员今年早些时候表示，美国销售的无人机中有超过 50% 由大疆创新制造，它们是公共安全机构最受欢迎的无人机。

Congress in 2019 banned the Pentagon from buying or using drones and components manufactured in China.翻译:国会于2019年禁止五角大楼购买或使用中国制造的无人机及零部件。

Reporting by David Shepardson in Washington Devika Nair in Bengaluru; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama and Mark Porter翻译:大卫·谢泼德森 (David Shepardson) 华盛顿报道 德维卡·奈尔 (Devika Nair) 班加罗尔报道；编辑：野山千津和马克·波特

item.title: 中国与俄罗斯顶级能源公司讨论开发油气田 - CNPC
item.description:
Summary:
  • This content was produced in Russia where the law restricts coverage of Russian military operations in Ukraine翻译:此内容在俄罗斯制作，该国法律限制报道俄罗斯在乌克兰的军事行动

China is in talks with Russia's Rosneft (ROSN.MM), Gazprom (GAZP.MM) and Novatek (NVTK.MM) about the joint development of oil and gas fields and hydrocarbon trade, state-owned China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC) said on Wednesday.翻译:国有的中国石油天然气集团公司（CNPC）表示，中国正在与俄罗斯石油公司（ROSN.MM） 、俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司（GAZP.MM）和诺瓦泰克公司（NVTK.MM）就联合开发油气田和碳氢化合物贸易进行谈判周三。

Russia is counting on a planned new pipeline to China as it seeks to make up for lost gas sales in Europe, but industry insiders see major political risks around a project that is overly dependent on one buyer and question whether it will justify the huge costs.翻译:俄罗斯正指望计划修建一条通往中国的新管道，以弥补欧洲天然气销售的损失，但业内人士认为，这一过度依赖单一买家的项目存在重大政治风险，并质疑其巨额成本是否合理。

"We are now discussing with Rosneft, Gazprom and Novatek questions on the joint development of oil and gas fields, widening the capacity of pipeline projects and trade of hydrocarbons," said CNPC Vice President Xie Jun at the St Petersburg International Gas Forum.翻译:中石油副总经理谢军在圣彼得堡国际天然气论坛上表示：“我们现在正在与俄罗斯石油公司、俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司和诺瓦泰克公司讨论联合开发油气田、扩大管道项目容量和碳氢化合物贸易的问题。”

CNPC and Gazprom are working on speeding up Russian gas supplies to China via the Far Eastern route, he added. Gazprom later said it had signed an agreement with the CNPC and PipeChina on design and construction of a pipeline section in the Far East.翻译:他补充说，中石油和俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司正在努力加快俄罗斯通过远东路线向中国供应天然气的速度。俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司随后表示，已与中国石油天然气集团公司和中国管道公司签署了一份关于远东管道段设计和施工的协议。

Russian gas supplies to China via the Power of Siberia pipeline began in December 2019 and are expected to reach the contractual level of 38 billion cubic metres (bcm) per year in 2025.翻译:俄罗斯通过西伯利亚力量管道向中国供应天然气于2019年12月开始，预计到2025年将达到每年380亿立方米的合同水平。

Gazprom signed a second contract to supply 10 bcm per year via the Far Eastern route in February 2022.翻译:俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司于 2022 年 2 月签署了第二份合同，每年通过远东航线供应 10 bcm。

Gazprom CEO Alexei Miller said the company was preparing to increase supplies to Central Asian countries Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan, and provide gas with cooperation for 15 years from 2024.翻译:俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司首席执行官阿列克谢·米勒表示，该公司准备增加对中亚国家乌兹别克斯坦、哈萨克斯坦和吉尔吉斯斯坦的供应，并从2024年开始提供为期15年的天然气合作。

Russia has been trying to redirect supplies to Asia since its major customers in Europe slashed Russian energy imports after Moscow launched what it calls a "special military operation" in Ukraine in February 2022.翻译:2022 年 2 月莫斯科在乌克兰发起所谓的“特别军事行动”后，俄罗斯在欧洲的主要客户大幅削减了俄罗斯能源进口，此后俄罗斯一直试图将供应转向亚洲。

Reporting by Oksana Kobzeva; Writing by Alexander Marrow, editing by David Evans翻译:奥克萨娜·科布泽娃 (Oksana Kobzeva) 报道；亚历山大·马罗撰稿，大卫·埃文斯编辑

item.title: 美联储决定前股市上涨；国债收益率下滑
item.description:
Summary:
  • Wall Street stocks higher in late morning trading翻译:华尔街股市早盘走高
  • Spotlight now on Fed, Powell speech翻译:现在聚焦美联储、鲍威尔讲话
  • Treasury yields slip after Treasury Department increases auction sizes翻译:财政部增加拍卖规模后国债收益率下滑

Global stock indexes were higher and the U.S. dollar was nearly flat on Wednesday ahead of the afternoon's Federal Reserve's policy decision, while Treasury yields slipped on Treasury Department plans to "gradually" boost the size of its debt auctions to meet financing needs.翻译:周三，在美联储下午做出政策决定之前，全球股指走高，美元几乎持平，而美国国债收益率因财政部计划“逐步”扩大债务拍卖规模以满足融资需求而下滑。

The Treasury Department said the size of most auctions from November to January 2024 will increase and that it will need one additional quarter of increases to meet its funding plans.翻译:财政部表示，从 11 月到 2024 年 1 月，大多数拍卖的规模都将增加，并且需要再增加四分之一才能满足其融资计划。

With the U.S. central bank widely expected to hold rates steady, investors will closely monitor Fed Chair Jerome Powell's speech to gauge where interest rates are headed and how long they will stay higher.翻译:由于普遍预计美联储将维持利率稳定，投资者将密切关注美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔的讲话，以判断利率走向以及利率将保持在较高水平多久。

Data showed a smaller-than-expected increase in U.S. private payrolls, which took some steam out of a still-tight labor market.翻译:数据显示，美国私营部门就业人数增幅低于预期，这给依然紧张的劳动力市场带来了一些动力。

Private payrolls rose by 113,000 jobs and data for September was unrevised to show an 89,000 addition, as previously reported. Economists polled by Reuters had forecast private payrolls rising 150,000 last month.翻译:私营部门就业人数增加了 113,000 个职位，9 月份的数据未经修改，如之前报道的那样，增加了 89,000 个职位。路透社调查的经济学家预计上个月私人就业人数将增加 15 万。

"For now, the Fed is very much in wait and see mode," said Niall O'Sullivan, chief investment officer, multi-asset strategies EMEA, at Neuberger Berman.翻译:Neuberger Berman 欧洲、中东和非洲多资产策略首席投资官 Niall O'Sullivan 表示：“目前，美联储基本上处于观望状态。”

The Japanese yen recovered somewhat on Wednesday after falling sharply the day before, when the Bank of Japan (BOJ) tweaked its bond yield control policy, loosening its grip on long-term rates and pushing the currency to a one-year low against the dollar.翻译:日元在前一天大幅下跌后，周三有所回升，当时日本央行(BOJ) 调整了债券收益率控制政策，放松了对长期利率的控制，并将日元兑美元汇率推至一年低点。

That was followed by a fresh and sterner warning from Japan's top currency diplomat Masato Kanda on Wednesday that authorities stood ready to respond to recent "one-sided, sharp" moves in the currency.翻译:随后，日本首席货币外交官神田正人周三发出新的、更严厉的警告，称当局已准备好应对近期“单方面、急剧”的汇率走势。

The Japanese yen strengthened 0.47% versus the greenback at 150.96 per dollar.翻译:日元兑美元汇率上涨 0.47%，至 1 美元兑 150.96 日元。

The U.S. dollar index was last up 0.07%.翻译:美元指数最新上涨0.07%。

On Wall Street, megacap stocks gained as bond yields eased.翻译:在华尔街，随着债券收益率下降，大型股上涨。

The Dow Jones Industrial Average (.DJI) rose 162.73 points, or 0.49%, to 33,215.6; the S&P 500 (.SPX) gained 30.21 points, or 0.72%, to 4,224.01; and the Nasdaq Composite (.IXIC) added 107.09 points, or 0.83%, to 12,958.33.翻译:道琼斯工业平均指数(.DJI)上涨 162.73 点，涨幅 0.49%，至 33,215.6 点；标准普尔 500 指数(.SPX)上涨 30.21 点，涨幅 0.72%，至 4,224.01 点；纳斯达克综合指数(.IXIC)上涨 107.09 点，至 12,958.33 点，涨幅为 0.83%。

The pan-European STOXX 600 index (.STOXX) rose 0.83% and MSCI's gauge of stocks across the globe (.MIWD00000PUS) gained 0.78%.翻译:泛欧 STOXX 600 指数(.STOXX)上涨 0.83%，MSCI 全球股票指数(.MIWD00000PUS)上涨 0.78%。

Japan's Nikkei (.N225) rose about 2% as investors remained on red alert for yen-buying intervention from authorities.翻译:日本日经指数(.N225)上涨约 2%，因投资者仍对当局干预日元购买行为保持红色警惕。

The yield on 10-year Treasury notes fell 0.4 basis point to 4.871%.翻译:10年期国债收益率下跌0.4个基点至4.871%。

Oil prices gained ahead of the Fed decision, with investors also keeping a close eye on the latest developments in the Israel-Hamas conflict.翻译:油价在美联储决定之前上涨，投资者也在密切关注以色列与哈马斯冲突的最新进展。

U.S. crude recently rose 2.41% to $82.97 per barrel and Brent was at $86.95, up 2.27% on the day.翻译:美国原油近期上涨2.41%至每桶82.97美元，布伦特原油上涨2.27%至86.95美元。

Earlier data Wednesday showed Asia's manufacturers faced worsening pressure in October with factory activity in China slipping back into decline, clouding recovery prospects for the region's major exporters already squeezed by weaker global demand and higher prices.翻译:周三早些时候的数据显示，亚洲制造商10月份面临着日益恶化的压力，中国的工厂活动重新陷入衰退，给已经受到全球需求疲软和价格上涨挤压的该地区主要出口商的复苏前景蒙上阴影。

Reporting by Caroline Valetkevitch; additional reporting by Lawrence White in London, Ankur Banerjee in Singapore and Amruta Khandekar and Shashwat Chauhan in Bengaluru; Editing by Alison Williams and Mark Potter翻译:卡罗琳·瓦莱特科维奇报道； Lawrence White 在伦敦、Ankur Banerjee 在新加坡以及 Amruta Khandekar 和 Shashwat Chauhan 在班加罗尔的补充报道；艾莉森·威廉姆斯和马克·波特编辑

item.title: 日本加强干预警告后日元上涨；美国数据打压美元
item.description:
Summary:
  • US manufacturing contracts in October翻译:美国10月制造业合约
  • US private sector jobs rise lower than expected翻译:美国私营部门就业增幅低于预期
  • Markets await Fed rate decision翻译:市场等待美联储利率决定

The struggling yen rose from a one-year low against the U.S. dollar and a 15-year trough versus the euro on Wednesday on threats of intervention from Japanese authorities, and as investors shifted focus to the Federal Reserve's policy decision later in the day.翻译:周三，由于日本当局威胁进行干预，以及投资者将注意力转向美联储当天晚些时候的政策决定，陷入困境的日元兑美元汇率从一年低点和兑欧元汇率创 15 年来低点上涨。

The dollar was on the defensive overall against some major currencies after U.S. data showed an economy that is slowing down in the wake of aggressive tightening by the Fed since March 2022.翻译:美国数据显示经济因美联储自 2022 年 3 月以来大幅紧缩政策而放缓，美元兑一些主要货币整体呈守势。

The greenback was last down 0.35% at 151.2 yen , after more pointed-than-normal remarks from Japan's top currency diplomat, Masato Kanda.翻译:日本首席货币外交官神田正人发表了比平常更为尖锐的言论后，美元兑日元汇率最后下跌 0.35%，至 151.2 日元。

It hit a one-year high on Tuesday as the yen slid after the Bank of Japan redefined its 1% limit on 10-year government bond yields as a reference rate rather than a hard cap.翻译:周二，日本央行将 10 年期政府债券收益率 1% 的上限重新定义为参考利率而非硬上限，导致日元下跌，日元汇率触及一年高点。

The tweak disappointed many investors who had been expecting a stronger move away from ultra-loose monetary policy.翻译:这一调整令许多投资者感到失望，他们原本期待采取更强有力的措施摆脱超宽松的货币政策。

"Kanda's comments put a little bit of a lid on dollar/yen overnight," said Vassili Serebriakov, FX strategist, at UBS in New York. "That's not a particularly sharp reversal. It cooled some of the upside momentum."翻译:瑞银驻纽约外汇策略师瓦西里·塞雷布里亚科夫表示，“神田的言论对隔夜美元/日元走势起到了一定的抑制作用”。 “这并不是一个特别剧烈的逆转。它冷却了一些上行动能。”

It was not enough to close the wide gap in bond yields between Japan and other countries, that has been responsible for the yen's almost 14% drop against the dollar this year.翻译:这还不足以缩小日本与其他国家之间债券收益率的巨大差距，而这一差距是今年日元兑美元汇率下跌近14%的原因。

The yen traded weaker than 160 per euro for the first time since 2008 on Tuesday, but recovered slightly to 159.36 per euro on Wednesday, up about 6%.翻译:周二，日元兑欧元汇率自2008年以来首次跌破160兑欧元，但周三小幅回升至159.36兑欧元，涨幅约6%。

"The market definitely will try to probe for where the red line is for the Ministry of Finance," said Alvin Tan, head of Asia FX strategy at RBC Capital Markets.翻译:加拿大皇家银行资本市场 (RBC Capital Markets) 亚洲外汇策略主管阿尔文·谭 (Alvin Tan) 表示：“市场肯定会尝试探索财政部的红线在哪里。”

"It's clear that it's not at 150 (per dollar) but you don't want to be out there in front when the Japanese authorities intervene."翻译:“很明显，价格不是 150（每美元），但当日本当局进行干预时，你不想站在前面。”

Wednesday's data showed slowing momentum for the world's largest economy.翻译:周三的数据显示世界最大经济体的增长势头正在放缓。

U.S. manufacturing contracted sharply in October after showing signs of improvement in prior months as new orders and employment slumped.翻译:由于新订单和就业下降，美国制造业在前几个月出现改善迹象后，10 月份大幅收缩。

The Institute for Supply Management (ISM) said its manufacturing PMI dropped to 46.7 last month from 49.0 in September, which was the highest reading since November 2022. It was the 12th consecutive month that the PMI remained below 50, which indicates contraction in manufacturing.翻译:美国供应管理协会(ISM)表示，其制造业PMI从9月份的49.0降至上个月的46.7，这是自2022年11月以来的最高读数。这是PMI连续第12个月保持在50以下，这表明制造业出现收缩。

Data also showed U.S. private payrolls increased less than expected in October and wage growth moderated. Private payrolls rose by 113,000 jobs last month after gaining 89,000 in September, the ADP National Employment report showed. Economists polled by Reuters had forecast private payrolls rising 150,000.翻译:数据还显示，10月份美国私人就业人数增幅低于预期，工资增长放缓。 ADP全国就业报告显示，继9月份增加89,000个之后，上个月私营部门就业人数增加113,000个。路透社调查的经济学家此前预测私人就业人数将增加 15 万。

The dollar has been tracking the movements in U.S. Treasury yields, which have surged due to a combination of concerns about the longer-term budget deficits as well as a resilient economy despite several rounds of rate increases by the Fed.翻译:美元一直在追踪美国国债收益率的走势，尽管美联储进行了几轮加息，但由于对长期预算赤字和经济弹性的担忧，美国国债收益率飙升。

"But if we see U.S. data slowing, that may be a stronger signal that yields would be capped," said UBS' Serebriakov. "We haven't seen that yet so the risk is more upside pressure in yields, which means the dollar can actually remain supported."翻译:瑞银的塞雷布里亚科夫表示：“但如果我们看到美国数据放缓，这可能是一个更强烈的信号，表明收益率将受到限制。” “我们还没有看到这种情况，因此风险是收益率面临更大的上行压力，这意味着美元实际上可以继续受到支撑。”

With the data out of the way, investors are now focused on the Fed rate decision later on Wednesday. Economists expect the Fed to keep interest rates on hold when it announces its decision at 1800 GMT (2 p.m. ET).翻译:随着数据公布，投资者现在关注周三晚些时候的美联储利率决定。经济学家预计美联储将在格林尼治标准时间 1800 点（东部时间下午 2 点）宣布决定时维持利率不变。

Investors will scrutinise Chair Jerome Powell's comments for hints about how long rates will stay at the current 5.25% to 5.5% level and whether there's a chance of them rising again.翻译:投资者将密切关注主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔 (Jerome Powell) 的言论，以获取有关利率将在当前 5.25% 至 5.5% 水平维持多久以及利率是否有再次上升机会的暗示。

The euro fell 0.2% to $1.0555 in the wake of Tuesday's fall in growth and inflation.翻译:继周二经济增长和通胀下滑之后，欧元下跌 0.2%，至 1.0555 美元。

The U.S. dollar index , which tracks the greenback against its major peers, was flat 106.71/ 0.22% to 106.9.翻译:追踪美元兑主要货币的美元指数持平于 106.71/0.22%，至 106.9。

It has traded sideways since hitting an almost one-year high of 107.34 in early October on the back of a sharp rise U.S. bond yields driven by strong economic growth.翻译:自10月初触及近一年高点107.34以来，由于经济强劲增长推动美国债券收益率大幅上升，该指数一直横盘整理。

item.title: 白宫计划于 11 月在旧金山举行拜登与习近平会晤
item.description:
Teams for U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping have an agreement in principle for them to meet in San Francisco in November but important details need to be hammered out, a senior Biden administration official said on Tuesday.翻译:拜登政府一名高级官员周二表示，美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平的团队已原则上达成协议，将于 11 月在旧金山会面，但重要细节需要敲定。

The official amplified on remarks by White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre at her daily press briefing, where she said the two leaders are aiming to have a "constructive conversation" on the sidelines of the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation forum in San Francisco.翻译:这位官员详细阐述了白宫新闻秘书卡琳·让-皮埃尔在每日新闻发布会上的讲话，她表示两国领导人计划在旧金山亚太经济合作论坛期间进行“建设性对话”。

"There is an agreement in principle to meet in San Francisco in November. We are still working through important details needed to finalize those plans," the official said.翻译:这位官员表示：“原则上已达成协议，将于 11 月在旧金山举行会议。我们仍在研究敲定这些计划所需的重要细节。”

Biden, his national security adviser Jake Sullivan and Secretary of State Antony Blinken discussed the prospect for a Biden-Xi summit in talks with Chinese foreign minister Wang Yi at the White House and at the State Department on Friday.翻译:拜登、他的国家安全顾问杰克·沙利文和国务卿安东尼·布林肯周五在白宫和国务院与中国外交部长王毅会谈时讨论了拜登与习近平峰会的前景。

The APEC summit is to take place in mid-November.翻译:APEC峰会将于11月中旬举行。

item.title: 拜登任命亚洲事务专家库尔特·坎贝尔为副国务卿
item.description:
President Joe Biden on Wednesday nominated one of his top national security aides, Kurt Campbell, as deputy secretary of state, a move that will put a veteran Asia hand in the No. 2 position at the U.S. State Department.翻译:美国总统乔·拜登周三提名他的一位高级国家安全助手库尔特·坎贝尔为副国务卿，此举将使这位亚洲资深人士成为美国国务院的二号人物。

The announcement comes two weeks before Biden hopes to meet Chinese President Xi Jinping at the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation forum in San Francisco. A senior U.S. official said on Tuesday that an "agreement in principle" for the meeting had been reached.翻译:这一消息是在拜登希望在旧金山亚太经济合作论坛上会见中国国家主席习近平两周前宣布的。一位美国高级官员周二表示，会议已达成“原则协议” 。

Campbell, 66, currently serves as coordinator for Indo-Pacific Affairs on the National Security Council. He previously founded and led The Asia Group, a strategic advisory and capital management group.翻译:坎贝尔现年 66 岁，目前担任国家安全委员会印度太平洋事务协调员。他此前创立并领导了战略咨询和资本管理集团亚洲集团。

His nomination as deputy secretary of state will require Senate confirmation.翻译:他担任副国务卿的提名需要参议院批准。

Campbell is viewed as an intellectual author of then-President Barack Obama's "pivot to Asia" strategy, a vaunted but so far still limited rebalancing of resources to the region.翻译:坎贝尔被视为时任总统巴拉克·奥巴马“重返亚洲”战略的思想家，该战略是一项备受吹捧但迄今为止仍然有限的该地区资源再平衡战略。

He outlined his approach to Asia in a 2016 book "The Pivot," which advocated strengthening existing alliances and building closer relations with states like India and Indonesia in the face of a rising China.翻译:他在 2016 年出版的《转向》一书中概述了自己的亚洲策略，主张加强现有联盟，并在面对崛起的中国时与印度和印度尼西亚等国家建立更密切的关系。

China poses a daunting diplomatic challenge for the United States, which wants to counter its growing military without provoking a conflict and to curb what Washington views as the country's unfair business practices while avoiding an all-out trade war.翻译:中国对美国构成了严峻的外交挑战，美国希望在不引发冲突的情况下对抗其不断增长的军事力量，并遏制华盛顿认为该国不公平的商业行为，同时避免全面的贸易战。

At the White House, Campbell has overseen the difficult relationship with China, which under the Trump and Biden administrations has deteriorated to its lowest level since normalization of diplomatic ties with Beijing in 1979.翻译:在白宫，坎贝尔负责监督与中国的困难关系，在特朗普和拜登政府的领导下，中美关系已恶化至 1979 年与北京实现外交关系正常化以来的最低水平。

item.title: 中国经济复苏缓慢，雅诗兰黛、加拿大鹅大幅削减年度目标
item.description:
Estee Lauder (EL.N) and Canada Goose Holdings (GOOS.TO), on Wednesday cut their annual forecasts as the luxury goods companies grapple with weak demand in high-growth market China.翻译:雅诗兰黛(EL.N)和加拿大鹅控股(GOOS.TO)周三下调了年度预期，因为这两家奢侈品公司正在努力应对高增长市场中国需求疲软的问题。

Estee's shares tumbled as much as 21% to hit an over six-year low of $102.22 while Canada Goose's stock shed 10%.翻译:雅诗兰黛 (Estee) 股价暴跌 21%，触及六年多低点 102.22 美元，而加拿大鹅 (Canada Goose) 股价下跌 10%。

Global companies ranging from L'Oreal (OREP.PA) to LVMH (LVMH.PA) have indicated that inflation and economic turmoil are curbing a post-pandemic spending spree, mainly in the world's second-largest economy China.翻译:欧莱雅(OREP.PA)和路威酩轩(LVMH.PA)等全球公司均表示，通胀和经济动荡正在抑制疫情后的消费热潮，尤其是在世界第二大经济体中国。

Luxury companies have also flagged a hit from Beijing's tighter controls of "daigou" resellers - people who buy items at lower prices abroad and resell them at a discount in the country.翻译:奢侈品公司还表示，北京对“代购”经销商的控制更加严格，这些经销商在国外以较低的价格购买商品，然后在国内以折扣价转售。

"They are very exposed to the daigou trade and are also big beneficiaries...the Chinese authorities have clearly clamped down on these bigger trades and it might have fundamentally changed the trade from here," said Javier Gonzalez Lastra, luxury-focused portfolio manager at Tema ETFs.翻译:专注于奢侈品的投资组合经理哈维尔·冈萨雷斯·拉斯特拉 (Javier Gonzalez Lastra) 表示：“他们在代购贸易中的风险敞口很大，也是大受益者……中国当局显然已经打压了这些规模更大的交易，这可能会从根本上改变目前的贸易状况。”在 Tema ETF。

Canada Goose, whose luxury parkas retail for over $1,000, said sales in China slowed in the second quarter from the preceding quarter, while Estee has struggled with a weaker-than-expected rebound in demand from fliers in Asia, mainly in travel destinations such as Korea and China's Hainan province.翻译:Canada Goose 的豪华派克大衣零售价超过 1,000 美元，该公司表示，第二季度在中国的销售较上一季度放缓，而雅诗兰黛 (Estee) 则因亚洲旅客需求反弹弱于预期而陷入困境，主要是在亚洲等旅游目的地韩国和中国海南省。

"Their (Canada Goose's) Chinese business has not gone back to what they would have anticipated at this point...," said Cole Smead of Smead Capital Management. "The people selling the stock today are just saying in the interim they do not think it is going to recover anytime soon."翻译:Smead Capital Management 的科尔·斯米德 (Cole Smead) 表示：“他们（加拿大鹅）的中国业务目前尚未恢复到他们预期的水平……”。 “今天出售该股票的人只是说，他们认为该股票暂时不会很快复苏。”

Smead Capital owns Canada Goose shares in its International Value portfolio.翻译:Smead Capital 持有其 International Value 投资组合中的 Canada Goose 股票。

Estee signaled that a resetting of inventory in Asia travel retail is expected to extend until the end of the third quarter of its financial year 2024.翻译:雅诗兰黛表示，亚洲旅游零售的库存重置预计将持续到2024财年第三季度末。

Duty-free retailer Dufry (DUFN.S) is expected to give a clearer picture of travel retail growth when it reports quarterly results on Thursday.翻译:免税零售商 Dufry (DUFN.S)预计将在周四报告季度业绩时给出更清晰的旅游零售增长情况。

Estee now expects adjusted profit per share between $2.17 and $2.42 for its full year, compared to a prior forecast of $3.50 to $3.75. It said disruptions caused by the conflict in the Middle East could have an 8 cents per share impact on profit.翻译:雅诗兰黛目前预计全年调整后每股利润在 2.17 美元至 2.42 美元之间，而之前的预测为 3.50 美元至 3.75 美元。该公司表示，中东冲突造成的中断可能会对每股利润产生 8 美分的影响。

Annual sales are estimated to decrease 2% to an increase of 1%, compared with a rise of between 5% and 7% earlier.翻译:年销售额预计将下降 2% 至增长 1%，而之前的增幅为 5% 至 7%。

Canada Goose expects 2024 revenue to be between C$1.20 billion ($864.49 million) and C$1.40 billion, compared to C$1.40 billion to C$1.50 billion estimated earlier.翻译:Canada Goose 预计 2024 年收入将在 12 亿加元（8.6449 亿美元）至 14 亿加元之间，而之前估计为 14 亿加元至 15 亿加元。

Annual adjusted profit is expected to be between C$0.60 and C$1.40 per share, compared to the prior range of C$1.20 to C$1.48.翻译:调整后的年度利润预计为每股 0.60 加元至 1.40 加元，而之前的范围为 1.20 加元至 1.48 加元。

Canada Goose also posted a nearly 11% decline in revenue in the United States region, on strained demand for high-end goods while Estee, seen as an affordable luxury, posted an 8% increase in sales in the Americas.翻译:由于高端商品需求紧张，加拿大鹅 (Canada Goose) 在美国地区的收入也下降了近 11%，而被视为平价奢侈品的雅诗兰黛 (Estee) 在美洲的销售额则增长了 8%。

($1 = 1.3881 Canadian dollars)翻译:（1 美元 = 1.3881 加元）

item.title: 印度授权苹果、戴尔、联想等公司进口笔记本电脑、平板电脑——消息人士
item.description:
Apple (AAPL.O), Dell (DELL.N), HP (HPE.N), Samsung (005930.KS) and Lenovo (0992.HK) are among 110 firms authorised by India to import laptops, tablets and personal computers under a new system aimed at monitoring shipments, two government sources said.翻译:苹果(AAPL.O) 、戴尔(DELL.N) 、惠普(HPE.N) 、三星(005930.KS)和联想(0992.HK)等 110 家公司获印度授权进口笔记本电脑、平板电脑和个人电脑。两名政府消息人士称，这是一个旨在监控货运的新系统。

Acer (2353.TW), Xiaomi (1810.HK), IBM (IBM.N) and ASUS (2357.TW) have also been issued import authorisations, the two sources said, under India's new "import management system" effective from Wednesday.翻译:两位消息人士称，根据周三起生效的印度新“ 进口管理制度”，宏碁（2353.TW） 、小米（1810.HK） 、IBM （IBM.N）和华硕（2357.TW）也已获得进口授权。

India announced the new system for laptops, tablets and personal computers last month after it rolled back an earlier plan to impose a licensing regime, following criticism from the industry and Washington.翻译:印度上个月宣布了适用于笔记本电脑、平板电脑和个人电脑的新系统，此前该国在受到业界和华盛顿的批评后，撤销了先前实施许可制度的计划。

Companies must register the quantity and value of imports on a portal, with an authorisation valid until September 2024.翻译:公司必须在门户网站上登记进口数量和价值，授权有效期至 2024 年 9 月。

India's federal trade ministry did not immediately respond to a request for comment. The sources declined to be named as details of the authorisations have not yet been made public.翻译:印度联邦贸易部没有立即回应置评请求。由于授权细节尚未公开，消息人士拒绝透露姓名。

item.title: 加拿大鹅因中国经济复苏艰难而下调销售预期并任命新首席财务官
item.description:
Canada Goose Holdings (GOOS.TO), cut its annual sales forecast on Wednesday, in a sign that a sharp rebound in China was starting to falter and sales in the U.S. stayed under pressure.翻译:加拿大鹅控股公司(GOOS.TO)周三下调了年度销售预期，这表明中国的大幅反弹开始放缓，而美国的销售仍面临压力。

While China demand bounced back in the prior two quarters, hopes for a sustained recovery in the market is uncertain.翻译:尽管中国需求在前两个季度出现反弹，但市场持续复苏的希望尚不确定。

The company, whose U.S.-listed shares fell 8% in premarket trading, also appointed current Deputy Finance Chief Neil Bowden as CFO. Bowden would succeed Jonathan Sinclair, who has been named president, APAC, effective April 1, 2024.翻译:该公司在美国上市的股价在盘前交易中下跌了 8%，还任命现任副财务总监尼尔·鲍登 (Neil Bowden) 为首席财务官。 Bowden 将接替 Jonathan Sinclair，后者已被任命为亚太区总裁，于 2024 年 4 月 1 日生效。

The Toronto, Ontario-based company expects fiscal 2024 revenue to be between C$1.20 billion ($864.30 million) and C$1.40 billion, compared with its previous forecast of C$1.40 billion to C$1.50 billion.翻译:这家总部位于安大略省多伦多的公司预计 2024 财年收入将在 12 亿加元（8.643 亿美元）至 14 亿加元之间，而之前的预测为 14 亿加元至 15 亿加元。

($1 = 1.3884 Canadian dollars)翻译:（1 美元 = 1.3884 加元）

item.title: 世贸组织延长中国与日本反倾销诉讼期限
item.description:
The World Trade Organisation has extended a deadline for China to adopt WTO rules until May 8, 2024 in a case initiated by Japan over anti-dumping measures on stainless steel products, the body said on Wednesday.翻译:世界贸易组织周三表示，在日本就不锈钢产品反倾销措施提起的案件中，中国采用世贸组织规则的最后期限延长至2024年5月8日。

This follows an agreement between China and Japan on the length of the time period, the WTO said in a statement, citing information communicated by the delegations of those countries.翻译:世贸组织在一份声明中援引这些国家代表团传达的信息称，这是在中国和日本就期限长度达成一致之后进行的。

item.title: 苹果的假日季度预测面临华为和中国市场疲软的威胁
item.description:
Apple investors will have one big question when the world's most valuable company reports earnings on Thursday - will Huawei's resurgence in China dampen its holiday-quarter expectations?翻译:当全球最有价值的公司周四公布财报时，苹果投资者将面临一个大问题——华为在中国的复兴是否会削弱其假日季度的预期？

The company, which will post results for the July-September period, is grappling with an uneven recovery in the world's second-largest economy and tougher competition from Huawei after the Chinese firm's new Mate 60 Pro series phones saw strong early sales.翻译:该公司将于 7 月至 9 月公布业绩，该公司正在努力应对世界第二大经济体复苏不平衡的问题，以及在华为新款 Mate 60 Pro 系列手机早期销售强劲后来自华为的更激烈竞争。

Apple's (AAPL.O) own iPhone 15 line-up has gotten off to a slow start in the crucial international market. Counterpoint estimates China sales of the latest series were nearly 5% lower compared with the iPhone 14 in the first 17 days after launch.翻译:苹果(AAPL.O)自己的 iPhone 15 系列在重要的国际市场上起步缓慢。 Counterpoint 估计，最新系列在推出后的前 17 天内，与 iPhone 14 相比，在中国的销量下降了近 5%。

"Strength of the iPhone 15 cycle is the key question heading into the December quarter," Bernstein analysts said, adding that they expected "muted" sales of the device due to a lack of new features, strained consumer spending and competition from Huawei.翻译:Bernstein 分析师表示：“iPhone 15 周期的强劲程度是进入 12 月份季度的关键问题。”他补充说，由于缺乏新功能、消费者支出紧张以及来自华为的竞争，他们预计该设备的销售将“低迷”。

Huawei sold 1.6 million units of its Mate 60 Pro in six weeks, and brokerages such as Jefferies have said the firm could take back much of the market share in the coming years it lost to Apple after U.S. sanctions in 2019 hammered its business.翻译:华为在六周内售出了 160 万部 Mate 60 Pro ，杰富瑞 (Jefferies) 等券商表示，在 2019 年美国制裁对其业务造成重创后，该公司可能会在未来几年夺回被苹果夺走的大部分市场份额。

Those fears, as well as a wider pullback in tech stocks due to high interest rates, knocked Apple shares down nearly 14% in the three months to October-end, compared with the tech-heavy Nasdaq's (.IXIC) 11% decline in the same period.翻译:这些担忧，以及高利率导致科技股大幅回调，导致苹果股价在截至 10 月底的三个月内下跌了近 14%，而以科技股为主的纳斯达克指数(.IXIC)在 2019 年 11 月的跌幅为 11%。同一时期。

But there are signs of an economic pick up in China. Data released last month showed the economy grew at a faster-than-expected clip of 4.9% in the third quarter - though less than the 6.3% expansion in the second quarter - while consumption and industrial activity also surprised on the upside in September.翻译:但中国经济出现回暖迹象。上个月公布的数据显示，第三季度经济增长 4.9%，快于预期，但低于第二季度 6.3% 的增速，而 9 月份消费和工业活动也出现意外增长。

The July-September period marks Apple's fiscal fourth quarter, and the company is expected to lay down a percentage target for sales growth for the October-December period - its fiscal first quarter that covers holiday-season shopping.翻译:7 月至 9 月是苹果公司的第四财季，预计该公司将为 10 月至 12 月期间的销售增长制定百分比目标，该公司第一财季涵盖假日季购物。

Wall Street analysts expect iPhone sales to rise about 6% in the October-December period, according to LSEG data. That is well below historical levels - barring 2022's holiday season quarter when Chinese COVID-19 curbs curtailed production of high-end iPhones, the average holiday quarter sales growth for the device has been 9.2% in the past four years.翻译:根据 LSEG 的数据，华尔街分析师预计 10 月至 12 月期间 iPhone 销量将增长约 6%。这远低于历史水平 - 除非 2022 年假日季季度中国因新冠肺炎 (COVID-19) 疫情限制了高端 iPhone 的产量，否则过去四年该设备假日季度的平均销量增长率为 9.2%。

However, the fiscal first-quarter projections suggest an improvement from an estimated increase of 2.8% for the three months ended September, marking the largest rise in iPhone sales since the start of this year.翻译:然而，第一财季预测显示，截至 9 月份的三个月的预计增幅为 2.8%，有所改善，这标志着 iPhone 销量出现今年年初以来的最大增幅。

Overall revenue is still expected to tick down nearly 1%, dragged by continued weakness in sales of the iPad and Mac, which are expected to fall 15% and 25%, respectively.翻译:受 iPad 和 Mac 销量持续疲软的拖累，整体收入预计仍将下降近 1%，预计分别下降 15% 和 25%。

Apple earlier this week unveiled new MacBook Pro and iMac computers and three new chips to power them. The machines aimed at professional users, come at a time when the PC market is showing signs of a pick up after its over two-years-long slump.翻译:苹果公司本周早些时候推出了新款 MacBook Pro 和 iMac 电脑以及为其提供动力的三款新芯片。这些针对专业用户的机器推出之际，个人电脑市场在经历了两年多的低迷之后出现了回升的迹象。

The decline in global PC shipments slowed for a third straight quarter in the July-September period, a sign that the market has bottomed out, according to research firm IDC.翻译:研究公司 IDC 的数据显示，7 月至 9 月期间，全球个人电脑出货量下降幅度连续第三个季度放缓，这表明市场已经触底。

The global smartphone market contracted 8% in this period, according to Counterpoint.翻译:据 Counterpoint 称，同期全球智能手机市场萎缩了 8%。

The company's services business will likely be a bright spot, with estimated growth of 11.3%. The segment has often outpaced growth in Apple's hardware business in recent years and now accounts for nearly a quarter of its total revenue.翻译:公司的服务业务将可能成为亮点，预计增长11.3%。近年来，该领域的增长速度往往超过了苹果硬件业务的增长，目前占其总收入的近四分之一。

Reporting by Yuvraj Malik in Bengaluru, Writing by Aditya Soni; Editing by Saumyadeb Chakrabarty翻译:Yuvraj Malik 在班加罗尔的报道，Aditya Soni 撰稿；编辑：Saumyadeb Chakrabarty

item.title: 早盘竞价：美联储、融资和就业迎接 11 月
item.description:
A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan翻译:迈克·多兰 (Mike Dolan) 对美国和全球市场未来一天的展望

Investors wishing to put a dark October behind them first need to negotiate Wednesday's Fed policy decision, Treasury's debt sale plans and the beginnings of a slew of labor market updates.翻译:希望将黑暗的十月抛在身后的投资者首先需要就周三的美联储政策决定、 财政部的债务出售计划以及一系列劳动力市场更新的开始进行谈判。

As world markets kick off a new month in better spirits that they were for most of the last one, overseas drama centred on Japan's yen - which plummeted close to last year's three-decade low of 151.94 on Tuesday after the Bank of Japan made only a minor tweak to its yield control policy.翻译:随着世界市场以比上个月大部分时间更好的状态开始新的一个月，海外戏剧性的焦点集中在日元上——周二，在日本央行仅做出了 151.94 美元的汇率后，日元暴跌至接近去年三年来的低点 151.94。对其收益率控制政策进行小幅调整。

Masato Kanda, Japan's top currency diplomat, protested the move on Wednesday, saying authorities were on "standby" to respond to the currency's "one-sided, sharp" slide - ramping up the rhetoric around yen-buying intervention. But that lifted the currency only slightly and it hovers about 151.27 first thing.翻译:日本首席货币外交官神田正人(Masato Kanda)周三对此举提出抗议，称当局已“待命”，以应对日元“单方面、急剧”下滑，加剧了围绕日元购买干预的言论。但这仅略微提振了该货币，并首先徘徊在 151.27 左右。

The problem is the BOJ may have loosened its 10-year bond buying target rate of 1% - but it's still committed to capping yields around there and did so yet again on Wednesday in another emergency operation that dragged yields back to 0.95%.翻译:问题是日本央行可能已经放松了 1% 的 10 年期债券购买目标利率，但它仍然致力于限制收益率，并在周三的另一次紧急操作中再次这样做，将收益率拖回 0.95%。

The weak yen and yield cap cheered Japan's Nikkei (.N225) stock index, which surged more than 2% earlier - helped by news of a more than doubling of Toyota's profits that lifted the auto giant's shares (7203.T) almost 5%.翻译:日元疲软和收益率上限提振了日本日经指数(.N225) ，该指数早些时候飙升逾 2%，这得益于丰田利润翻倍多的消息，这使得这家汽车巨头的股价(7203.T)上涨了近 5%。

Does the yen drama matter for U.S. markets? At the margin at least, the concern is that protracted yen intervention and dollar sales by Japan may also cut its demand for U.S. Treasuries at a sensitive time - while higher yields there drag Japanese bond investors back home.翻译:日元戏剧性事件对美国市场重要吗？至少在某种程度上，人们担心，日本长期干预日元和抛售美元也可能会在敏感时期削减其对美国国债的需求，而美国国债收益率上升则拖累日本债券投资者回国。

Despite the U.S. Treasury forecasting a lower fourth-quarter borrowing need than previously flagged, the tension in the bond market remains ahead of its detailed future refinancing plans due later on Wednesday. Key will be the amount of this year's whopping $1.6 trillion of bill sales it will have to roll into longer-term debt securities through 2024.翻译:尽管美国财政部预测第四季度借款需求将低于此前的预期，但在周三晚些时候公布详细的未来再融资计划之前，债券市场的紧张局势仍然存在。关键在于今年高达 1.6 万亿美元的票据销售金额必须在 2024 年之前转入长期债务证券。

With the Federal Reserve widely expected to hold policy rates steady again on Wednesday, the Treasury plans may end up getting more bond market attention. Ten-year yields nudged back higher to 4.89% overnight ahead of the two events.翻译:由于普遍预计美联储将在周三再次维持政策利率稳定，财政部计划最终可能会引起债券市场更多关注。在这两个事件发生之前，十年期国债收益率隔夜回升至 4.89%。

Fed officials will cast a wary eye over data released on Tuesday showing employment cost inflation picking up during the last quarter alongside accelerating house price rises in September.翻译:美联储官员将对周二公布的数据保持警惕，该数据显示上个季度就业成本通胀上升，同时 9 月份房价加速上涨。

But U.S. consumer confidence has softened, oil prices are falling again and the overseas demand picture is weakening.翻译:但美国消费者信心已经疲软，油价再次下跌，海外需求形势正在减弱。

Despite all the handwringing about the impact on energy prices from the Middle East conflict, U.S. crude prices fell to their lowest since August on Tuesday - to just above $80 per barrel and clocking year-on-year declines of some 7% that are the deepest since August too.翻译:尽管中东冲突对能源价格的影响令人担忧，但美国原油价格周二跌至 8 月以来的最低水平，略高于每桶 80 美元，同比跌幅约为 7%，创历史新高。也是从八月份开始。

With euro zone GDP numbers showing a contraction of the bloc's economy in the third quarter - in stark contrast to the boom in the United States - China's economy again showed signs of faltering on Wednesday.翻译:欧元区GDP数据显示第三季度该集团经济出现收缩——与美国的繁荣形成鲜明对比——周三中国经济再次显示出步履蹒跚的迹象。

Chinese factory activity unexpectedly contracted in October, a private survey showed on Wednesday, adding to a downbeat official manufacturing purchasing managers' index on Tuesday.翻译:周三的一项私人调查显示， 中国十月份工厂活动意外收缩，进一步加剧了周二悲观的官方制造业采购经理人指数。

The property bust smoulders, meantime. China Evergrande (3333.HK) proposed a new debt restructuring plan for offshore bondholders, offering to swap debts into 30% equity stakes in each of the developer's two Hong Kong-listed subsidiaries.翻译:与此同时，房地产泡沫破裂。 中国恒大（3333.HK）向境外债券持有人提出新的债务重组计划，提出将债务置换为该开发商两家香港上市子公司各30%的股权。

The gloom was only partly offset by hopes for an easing of political tensions as the White House confirmed President Joe Biden and his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, now aim for a "constructive conversation" on the sidelines of the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation forum in San Francisco this month.翻译:白宫证实，美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平现在的目标是在旧金山举行的亚太经济合作论坛期间进行“建设性对话”，因此政治紧张局势缓和的希望仅部分抵消了这种阴郁情绪。弗朗西斯科这个月。

Beyond Tokyo, stocks elsewhere were more mixed and Wall Street futures pulled back slightly after the S&P500 (.SPX) recorded its first consecutive daily gains in three weeks. The new month saw a big retreat in the Vix (.VIX) volatility gauge to below 18.翻译:除东京以外，其他地方的股市涨跌互现，在标准普尔 500 指数(.SPX)录得三周来首次连续每日上涨后，华尔街期货小幅回落。新的一个月，Vix (.VIX)波动率指标大幅回落至 18 以下。

Another heavy day of U.S. corporate earnings is topped by big insurers and the likes of PayPal and Kraft Heinz.翻译:美国企业财报又迎来了沉重的一天，其中大型保险公司以及贝宝（PayPal）和卡夫亨氏（Kraft Heinz）等公司的业绩表现最为出色。

On Tuesday, shares in heavy-machinery maker Caterpillar (CAT.N) sank almost 7% as signs of slowing demand overshadowed a quarterly earnings beat. But Pinterest (PINS.N) shares surged almost 20% after the image-sharing platform beat estimates.翻译:周二，重型机械制造商卡特彼勒(CAT.N)的股价下跌近 7%，原因是需求放缓的迹象盖过了季度盈利的增长。但在图像共享平台Pinterest (PINS.N)超出预期后，其股价飙升近 20%。

Key developments that should provide more direction to U.S. markets later on Wednesday:翻译:周三晚些时候将为美国市场提供更多方向的关键事态发展：

* Federal Reserve policy decision and press conference翻译:* 美联储政策决定及新闻发布会

* U.S. Treasury quarterly refunding details翻译:* 美国财政部季度退款详情

* U.S. Oct ADP private sector payrolls, Sept JOLTS job openings data, ISM and S&P Global Oct manufacturing surveys翻译:* 美国 10 月 ADP 私营部门就业数据、9 月 JOLTS 职位空缺数据、ISM 和标普全球 10 月制造业调查

* U.S. corporate earnings: PayPal, Edison, AIG, Prudential Financial, MetLife, Qualcomm, Mckesson, Airbnb, Estee Lauder, Kraft Heinz, Marathon, Allstate, Congnizant Technology, Ingersoll Rand, Boston Properties, American Water Works, ETSY, ANSYS, Albermarle, Garmin, CVS, IDEXX, Yum! Brands, Humana, etc翻译:* 美国企业盈利：PayPal、Edison、AIG、Prudential Financial、MetLife、Qualcomm、Mckesson、Airbnb、雅诗兰黛、卡夫亨氏、马拉松、好事达、Congnizant Technology、英格索兰、Boston Properties、American Water Works、ETSY、ANSYS、Albermarle 、Garmin、CVS、IDEXX、百胜！品牌、Humana 等

item.title: 北京雾霾笼罩华北部分地区
item.description:
Hazy weather hung over Beijing on Wednesday with conditions in other parts of north China possibly worsening, forecasters said, although cold air sweeping in from the northwest is expected to help dissipate the smog.翻译:预报员表示，周三北京上空出现雾霾天气，华北其他地区的情况可能会恶化，但预计从西北吹来的冷空气将有助于驱散雾霾。

Experts attributed the haze in Beijing, which has lasted for several days, to poor atmospheric diffusion because of unseasonably weak cold air currents from the north.翻译:专家将北京持续多日的雾霾归因于来自北方的冷气流反常微弱，导致大气扩散不良。

Visibility in most parts of Beijing dropped to less than 500 metres (546 yards), the China Meteorological Administration said.翻译:中国气象局表示，北京大部分地区的能见度降至不足 500 米（546 码）。

"I didn't expect the smog to be so bad these days. The masks I've brought are almost used up," said a 24-year-old Beijing tourist surnamed Gao.翻译:“没想到这几天雾霾这么严重，我带的口罩都快用完了。”24岁的北京游客高姓游客说。

In some places, heavy winter fog was adding to the murky conditions and visibility was less than 50 metres in parts of Hebei province and Tianjin city.翻译:部分地区冬季大雾天气，河北省、天津市部分地区能见度不足50米。

Moderate to heavy air pollution was expected in the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei area and surrounding cities until Thursday, with short bouts of severe conditions, the environment ministry said after a meeting of its agencies.翻译:环保部在召开部属部门会议后表示，预计截至周四，京津冀地区及周边城市将出现中度至重度空气污染，并伴有短暂的严重天气。

While the north of the region will improve in the first half of this month, pollution may persist in southern areas, it said.翻译:报告称，虽然该地区的北部地区将在本月上半月有所改善，但南部地区的污染可能持续存在。

"The overall environment is getting better these years but in recent days the smog has come back. We're not sure what's exactly causing it," said an 82-year-old Beijing resident surnamed Liu.翻译:“这些年整体环境在好转，但最近几天雾霾又回来了，不知道到底是什么原因造成的。”82岁的北京刘姓居民说。

Temperatures were unusually similar to early summer, with some places recording 10 degrees Celsius above normal and likely to persist until Thursday, forecasters said, adding that records are likely to be broken in big cities such as Jinan, Zhengzhou and Shijiazhuang.翻译:预报员表示，气温与初夏异常相似，一些地方的气温比正常水平高出10摄氏度，并可能持续到周四，并补充说，济南、郑州和石家庄等大城市的气温记录可能会被打破。

Beijing's observatory in the last ten days of October recorded an average temperature for 3.4 degree Celsius higher than normal, breaking records for the same period since 1961, local media said.翻译:据当地媒体报道，北京气象台10月最后10天的平均气温较常年偏高3.4摄氏度，打破了1961年以来的同期记录。

The average temperature for the month was second highest in 62 years, after 2006's record.翻译:该月平均气温创 62 年来第二高，仅次于 2006 年的记录。

But from Thursday night, cold air is expected to push temperatures lower, possibly to new lows.翻译:但从周四晚上开始，冷空气预计将导致气温下降，甚至可能创下新低。

Reporting by Liz Lee, Ethan Wang and Xiaoyu Yin; Editing by Robert Birsel and Sonali Paul翻译:Liz Lee、Ethan Wang、Xiaoyu Yin 报道；罗伯特·伯塞尔和索纳利·保罗编辑

item.title: 中国资深气候特使谢将于12月下台-政府消息人士
item.description:
China's veteran climate change envoy, Xie Zhenhua, is set to retire in December at the end of this year's COP28 climate talks in Dubai, a government official familiar with the situation confirmed on Wednesday.翻译:一位熟悉情况的政府官员周三证实，中国资深气候变化特使解振华将于今年 12 月在迪拜举行的 COP28 气候谈判结束时退休。

Xie, who turns 74 this month, will be replaced by Liu Zhenmin, a former Chinese vice-foreign minister and United Nations Under-Secretary General, according to the official, who declined to be named because he was not authorised to speak to the media.翻译:这位官员表示，本月将满 74 岁的谢霆锋将由前中国外交部副部长兼联合国副秘书长刘振民接替。该官员拒绝透露姓名，因为他无权向媒体发表讲话。

Born in Tianjin in 1949, Xie served as China's top environmental official from 1999 to 2005, when he was forced to step down after a catastrophic benzine explosion left 5 million people without water supplies.翻译:谢先生1949年出生于天津，1999年至2005年期间担任中国最高环保官员，在一次灾难性的汽油爆炸导致500万人断水后被迫下台。

He first represented China in global climate negotiations in 2007 after his appointment as vice-chairman of the National Development and Reform Commission, the country's state planning agency. He led China's delegation during ill-fated and sometimes ill-tempered climate negotiations in Copenhagen in December 2009.翻译:2007年，他被任命为国家发展和改革委员会副主任，首次代表中国参加全球气候谈判。 2009年12月，他率领中国代表团参加了在哥本哈根举行的命运多舛、有时甚至脾气暴躁的气候谈判。

Experts say his friendly relationship with U.S. counterpart Todd Stern was vital in achieving consensus between the world's top two greenhouse gas emitters and helped get the landmark 2015 Paris Agreement over the line.翻译:专家表示，他与美国同行托德·斯特恩的友好关系对于全球最大的两个温室气体排放国之间达成共识至关重要，并帮助达成具有里程碑意义的2015年《巴黎协定》。

"The role of individuals matters a great deal in climate diplomacy," said Li Shuo, senior adviser at Greenpeace in Beijing.翻译:“个人的作用在气候外交中非常重要，”北京绿色和平组织高级顾问李硕说。

"Over his long tenure as China's chief negotiator, Xie has demonstrated that it is possible to bridge the differences between China and the West," he added.翻译:他补充说：“在担任中国首席谈判代表的长期任期中，谢已经证明弥合中国与西方之间的分歧是可能的。”

Climate talks between Washington and Beijing broke down during the presidency of Donald Trump, and Xie quit as envoy a year later. He remained involved in building climate ties with the United States, helping set up the California-China Climate Institute with then governor Jerry Brown.翻译:华盛顿和北京之间的气候谈判在唐纳德·特朗普担任总统期间破裂，一年后，谢辞去特使职务。他仍然致力于与美国建立气候关系，与时任州长杰里·布朗一起帮助建立了加州-中国气候研究所。

He returned as special envoy in 2021 after the election of President Joe Biden brought the United States back into the Paris Agreement, but his friendship with Stern's replacement, John Kerry, has not been enough to overcome rising geopolitical tensions between the countries.翻译:2021年，乔·拜登总统当选，美国重新加入《巴黎协定》后，他以特使身份回归，但他与斯特恩继任者约翰·克里的友谊并不足以克服两国之间日益加剧的地缘政治紧张局势。

China has repeatedly told the United States that climate change is not a diplomatic "oasis" that could be separated from broader disputes between the two sides, including U.S. tariffs and sanctions on Chinese-produced solar panels.翻译:中国一再告诉美国，气候变化不是一个外交“绿洲” ，不能与两国之间更广泛的争端分开，包括美国对中国生产的太阳能电池板征收关税和制裁。

Formal talks resumed between Xie and Kerry in Beijing in July this year and the two are set to meet again this week ahead of an APEC summit in San Francisco.翻译:谢和克里于今年7月在北京恢复了正式会谈，两人定于本周在旧金山举行的亚太经合组织峰会之前再次会面。

Reporting by Muyu Xu and David Stanway in Singapore, Editing by William Maclean翻译:徐木宇和大卫·斯坦威驻新加坡报道，威廉·麦克林编辑

item.title: 中国公司推出股指以迎合避险黄金热潮
item.description:
China's biggest index provider launched on Wednesday two gold-linked stock indices to cash in on surging demand for exposure to the safe-haven metal amid a slump in the local real estate market and volatile global markets.翻译:中国最大的指数提供商周三推出了两个与黄金挂钩的股票指数，以利用在当地房地产市场低迷和全球市场动荡之际对避险金属的需求激增。

The new indexes (.CSI931493), (.CSI931413), launched by the China Securities Index Co, include shares of global gold miners such as Newmont Corporation (NEM.N) and Barrick Gold .翻译:中证指数公司推出的新指数（.CSI931493） 、 （.CSI931413）包括纽蒙特公司（NEM.N）和巴里克黄金等全球黄金矿商的股票。

"The indexes offer a new method beyond traditional strategies," the government-backed index company said in a statement. "It provides the market with more tools to invest in the gold business, and can help households better manage their wealth."翻译:这家政府支持的指数公司在一份声明中表示：“这些指数提供了一种超越传统策略的新方法。” “它为市场提供了更多投资黄金业务的工具，并可以帮助家庭更好地管理财富。”

Spot gold has gained more than 8% so far this year, rising to an almost six-month high of $2,009 an ounce last week. In yuan terms , it is up more than 15% for the year so far.翻译:今年迄今为止，现货黄金已上涨超过 8%，上周升至近六个月高点 2,009 美元/盎司。以人民币计算，今年迄今已上涨超过 15%。

Miners, which typically pay dividends, have also seen their shares rise, with an index tracking China-listed gold miners (.CSI930619) up nearly 15%, compared with an 8% drop in the benchmark CSI300 Index (.CSI300) so far this year.翻译:通常派发股息的矿业股的股价也有所上涨，追踪中国上市黄金矿业股的指数(.CSI930619)上涨近 15%，而基准沪深 300 指数(.CSI300)迄今为止已下跌 8%。年。

"Gold is the brightest asset at the moment... promising much better returns than Chinese property or the broad stock market," said Shihua Duan, general manager of Shanghai Changer Invest.翻译:上海长尔投资总经理段世华表示：“黄金是目前最亮眼的资产……其回报率比中国房地产或大盘股市要高得多。”

"Gold shines as a safe haven against the backdrop of the Ukraine war, economic woes and the Middle East conflict."翻译:“在乌克兰战争、经济困境和中东冲突的背景下，黄金作为避风港闪闪发光。”

The indices follow the launch of other Chinese gold-related investment products that offer exposure in a country where gold consumption in the first three quarters of 2023 climbed 7.32%.翻译:该指数是在中国推出其他与黄金相关的投资产品之后推出的，这些产品提供了中国2023年前三季度黄金消费量增长7.32%的投资机会。

China Asset Management Co and Maxwealth Fund Management Co last month launched China's first exchange-traded funds (ETFs) (517520.SS) that invest in gold stocks. Another seven mutual fund companies have applied to launch similar products.翻译:华夏基金和永赢基金管理公司上个月推出了中国首只投资黄金股的交易所交易基金（ETF） （517520.SS） 。另有七家共同基金公司已申请推出类似产品。

"Buying the gold bar is the safest among so many investment choices," said gold investor Jack Liu, who spent 230,000 yuan ($31,425) on a gold bar in September.翻译:“在众多投资选择中，购买金条是最安全的，”黄金投资者 Jack Liu 说道，他在 9 月份花费了 23 万元人民币（合 31,425 美元）购买了一根金条。

($1 = 7.3190 Chinese yuan renminbi)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.3190 人民币）

item.title: 万圣节狂欢者聚集在上海，一些人穿着被视为抗议中国政策的服装
item.description:
Halloween revellers thronged central Shanghai late on Tuesday night, with some dressed in costumes that poked fun at China's strict COVID-19 curbs in a rare showcase of free expression as police looked on.翻译:周二深夜，万圣节狂欢者聚集在上海市中心，一些人穿着戏服，在警察的注视下，罕见地表达了自由言论，取笑中国严格的 COVID-19 限制措施。

Celebrations in the Chinese financial hub began on the weekend, culminating on Tuesday in a large crowd of mostly young people that gathered around a popular bar area, according to onlookers and social media posts.翻译:据旁观者和社交媒体帖子称，中国金融中心的庆祝活动从周末开始，周二，一大群年轻人聚集在一个受欢迎的酒吧区，庆祝活动达到高潮。

While most attendees did not dress up and many of those who did wore outfits like monsters and superheros, some attracted attention on social media for costumes such as blue and white hazmat suits that gained infamy in China last year for being used by authorities enforcing COVID-19 curbs known as "dabai".翻译:虽然大多数与会者都没有盛装打扮，而且许多参加者都穿着怪物和超级英雄的服装，但一些人因蓝色和白色防护服等服装在社交媒体上引起了关注，去年，这些服装因被执法部门使用而在中国声名狼藉。 19条路边称为“大白”。

Almost a year ago Shanghai was the site of historic protests over China's stringent COVID restrictions that spread to several cities and which were later seen as a trigger for the country's sudden lifting of the policy in December last year.翻译:大约一年前，上海爆发了针对中国严格的新冠疫情限制措施的历史性抗议活动，抗议活动蔓延到多个城市，后来被视为中国去年 12 月突然取消该政策的触发因素。

Social media posts from Tuesday and the days before included one of a man donning boards illustrating China's slumping stock market and another dressed up as Lu Xun, a famous author whose works have been popular among Chinese youth as they grapple with historic rates of unemployment.翻译:周二和前几天的社交媒体帖子中，一名男子穿着展示中国股市暴跌的图板，另一名男子装扮成著名作家鲁迅，他的作品在中国年轻人中很受欢迎，因为他们正努力应对创纪录的失业率。

The man recited a work by the author that urged those "who can speak out to speak out", before he was told to leave by a police officer, the video showed. Reuters was unable to verify the authenticity of the video.翻译:视频显示，这名男子背诵了作者的一首作品，敦促那些“能说话的人大声说话”，然后警察让他离开。路透社无法核实该视频的真实性。

"The 'dabai', COVID-19 testing, A-share market...that Shanghai people dressed up as are all elements that speak to the trauma of the times and traces of history. Once again, entertainment is not superficial, behind it are real life scars," said one user on Weibo on Wednesday.翻译:“‘大白’、COVID-19检测、A股市场……上海人的装扮，都是诉说着时代创伤和历史痕迹的元素。再次强调，娱乐不是表面的，它的背后是现实生活中的伤疤，”一位用户周三在微博上说道。

Public critiques of government policies are rare in China, where authorities have been cracking down on free expression.翻译:在中国，对政府政策的公开批评很少见，因为当局一直在打压言论自由。

Some party goers also showed up with blank sheets of paper stuck to their clothes, a key symbol of last year's protests, other social media posts showed.翻译:其他社交媒体帖子显示，一些参加聚会的人的衣服上还贴着白纸，这是去年抗议活动的一个重要标志。

There was little sign of aggressive efforts to stop the gathering by police, but some people in costumes that could be perceived as subversive were filmed being escorted away.翻译:几乎没有迹象表明警方采取了积极措施阻止集会，但一些穿着可能被视为颠覆性服装的人被拍到被护送离开。

Reporting by Brenda Goh; Additional reporting by Casey Hall and Eduardo Baptista in Beijing; Editing by Michael Perry翻译:布伦达·吴报道； Casey Hall 和 Eduardo Baptista 在北京的补充报道；迈克尔·佩里编辑
